newsitem.title: NEPAL: Nepal's King Birendra marks 25 years on the throne.
newsitem.headline: Nepal's King Birendra marks 25 years on the throne.

text.p: Tens of thousands of Nepalis on Friday gathered to celebrate King Birendra's 25th year on the throne in the world's only Hindu kingdom.
Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba gave an address in honour of the 52-year-old king whose role was reduced to that of a constitutional monarch in 1990 after a popular pro-democracy movement.
About 45 people were killed during that campaign before the king agreed to a parliamentary system in Nepal.
Two military helicopters showered flower petals on the national stadium where Nepalis from all walks of life had arrived to greet the king.

Different communities of the mountainous kingdom presented their cultural tableaux on the occasion which capped the year- long celebrations to honour the king, considered by the Hindus as the incarnation of Lord Vishnu, the protector of human kind.

After his accession to the throne in 1972, King Birendra ruled the Himalayan kingdom, one of the world's 10 poorest countries, as an absolute monarch until 1990 when he lifted a ban on political parties imposed by his father in 1960.

"Seven years ago we promulgated the constitution... reinstating a parliamentary system of governement in the country in accordance with the wishes of our people," the king said in his first public speech since 1990.
Under the constitution prepared in 1990, King Birendra has ceded all powers except that as constitutional monarch. He has abstained from politics which has made him popular among the people.
